p: Immunotherapy is an effective intervention in viral infections. Most attempts at immunotherapy were successful in fighting viruses similar to SARS-CoV-2. The principal methods include vaccine, neutralizing antibodies (nAbs) candidates and convalescent plasma. 35, 60, 66, 67, 155, 318, 319 In addition, according to the evidences from viral infections (Ebola, Influenza, SARS and MERS), immunotherapeutic interventions can reduce viral load and mortality rate of patients. 320, 321
